headline: MrBeast Says First Person To Crack His Super Bowl Ad Puzzle Wins $1 Million: Here's What You Have To Do
summary: MrBeast said viewers who solve hidden clues in his Super Bowl ad can win $1 million as Salesforce uses the YouTube star's first Big Game appearance to promote Slack's AI assistant, even as the company's shares show mixed market performance.

headline: Salesforce Army Deal And AI Push Reframe Growth And Valuation Outlook
summary: Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) has secured a 10 year, US$5.6b contract with the U.S. Army to support modernization and unification of military operations using its cloud and AI tools. The company is undergoing leadership changes, including departures at Tableau and Slack, as it adjusts to competitive pressure from fast moving AI platforms. Salesforce is also working with partners in the EMBERPOINT joint venture, aiming to apply AI and data capabilities to wildfire prevention and response. For...

headline: AI Fear Grips Wall Street as a New Stock Market Reality Sets In
summary: Last week, those concerns suddenly spilled over into the stock market.  In response, investors dumped a broad range of stocks, from Expedia Group Inc. to Salesforce Inc. to London Stock Exchange Group Plc.  “Things are shipping out weekly, daily,” said Daniel Newman, chief executive officer of the Futurum Group.

headline: Dan Ives Says Software Selloff Is Worst He's Seen In 25 Years As Microsoft, Salesforce Face Brutal AI Reckoning
summary: On Thursday, Wedbush analyst Dan Ives said that Wall Street is punishing software stocks like Salesforce Inc. (NYSE:CRM), ServiceNow Inc. (NYSE:NOW) and Microsoft Corp (NASDAQ:MSFT) as if they are no longer relevant in the AI age. Ives: Historic Selloff Unlike Anything Before Speaking with Bloomberg, Ives addressed the ongoing drawdowns in software stocks.
